summary: about:home (homepage) doesn't switch to overflowed mode when it's loaded in a narrow content area

comments.text:
>>>   My Info:   Win7_64, Nightly 48, 32bit, ID 20160312030405
STR:
0. Launch new profile. Set firefox as default browser, set "When Nightly Starts" to "Show Homepage"
1. Open homepage (about:home) in a new tab, resize application window (or open bookmarks
   sidebar/history sidebar/some site in sidebar) so that homepage switched to overflow mode,
   but there still was no horizontal scrollbar
2. Restart firefox
3. Scroll the page to the righ using scrollbar

AR:
 Homepage hasn't switched to overflow mode, so all buttons are displayed horizontally.
 Downloads button is invisible. Background of "Restore Session" button is partially clipped

ER:  
 Homepage should switch to overflow mode, or at least all buttons including
 "Downloads" button should be fully visible if I scroll the page using scrollbar.
 Background of "Restore Previous Session" button should cover the whole button.
comments.author: arni2033@yandex.ru

comments.text:
STR:
(assuming comment 0 was scenario A, here're scenarios B,C,D)
0. Launch new profile. Set firefox as default browser, set "When Nightly Starts" to "Show Homepage"
1. Open homepage (about:home) in a new tab, resize window so that homepage switched to overflow mode
2.B) Press Ctrl+R (reload tab)
2.C) Open new tab, press Alt+Home (open homepage)
2.D) Open new tab, press Ctrl+W (close tab), then Ctrl+Shift+T (restore tab)


To clarify this:   I never use homepage as it became malicious after all those "enhancements".
But I sometimes test Nightly and it's pretty... sad to see this breakage.
